bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Copy of Original Warrant
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: This form is taken from Mill's United States Commissioners Manual.
The W. H. Anderson Co., Law Publishers, Cincinnati, Ohio.
The President of the United States of America,
To the Marshal of the United States for the Western District of Washington and to his Deputies or Any or Either of Them:

WHEREAS, Tom Waters, Deputy U.S. Marshal has made complaint in writing under oath before me, the undersigned, a United States Commissioner for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division charging that Fletcher Decker late of King County, in the State of Washn did, on or about the 15th day of November, A. D. 1915, at Wiwa Hill Post Office, Province of Saskatchewan, Canada, in said District, in violation of Section of Canadian Statute, and extraditable under #5270 R.S. of the Revised Statutes of the United States, unlawfully steal, take, & carry away Flax seed. contrary to the form of the statute in such cases made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the United States of America.

NOW, THEREFORE, YOU ARE HEREBY COMMANDED, in the name of the President of the United States of America, to apprehend the said Defendant wherever found in your District, and bring his body forthwith before me or any other Commissioner having jurisdiction of said matter, to answer the said complaint, that he may then and there be dealt with according to law for the said offense.
Given under my hand and seal with 4th day of August, A.D. 1921

I hereby certify that I am, and was on the 14th day of Octover A.D. 1915 by Order of the United States District Court, for Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at Seattle, Wn. duly authorized to hear and determine all matters of extradition of fugitives from justice from foreign countries.
